flowRoot.flowPara: Window grouping
One window half-screen snapped
When two windows are snapped on opposite sides at the same time, they are grouped. When this happens, their relative sizes can be adjusted by dragging the join.
Joined snapped windows are treated like any other window - they can be obscured and share workspaces with other windows.
Activities overview
Existing approach
Highlight is shown when dragging against the screen edge

After snapping one window, the other windows on the workspace spread out, allowing one to be selected for the other side. Focusing the first window cancels this selection step. It is only shown for half tiling, and not quarter tiling.

This could be done when the second window is an obvious choice? (eg. if there's only two windows visible, or two windows on the workspace). However, it would result in inconsistent behavior - in some cases the second window would be automatically snapped, and in some it wouldn't. Also, how would the preview be presented prior to releasing the drag operation?
Would it make sense to require the second window to be selected in order to group?
Initial drag to side of screen
Drag and drop is completed - window picker fills the other side of the screen
Second window is selected
Select second window using a picker
Automatically snap the second window
Existing approach
Window grouping
Two grouped windows
Activities overview - two grouped windows
Two grouped windows, one regular window
Activities overview - two grouped windows, one regular window
Initiating window snapping
Applications could offer "view side-by-side" functionality.
Through an option in the app
